basics.name: Patrick Deng
basics.label: Data Engineer Analyst
basics.summary: Data Engineer Analyst, Computer Science Student

work.name: Walmart Canada
work.summary: Based in Mississauga, Ontario, supported data science, engineering, and analytics functions within a dynamic data engineering team
highlights: Collaborated in an agile data engineering team, delivering high-quality work in a fast-paced, project-driven environment.
Leveraged GCP BigQuery for analyzing database structures and processing large-scale data, optimizing queries to reduce costs.
Developed SQL and Python functions for data transformation and routine operations, implemented via Airflow to increase efficiency and standardize processes.
Supported marketing initiatives with customer targeting personas and ad tracking, improving ROI by enhancing data accuracy.
Executed ETL processes to deliver data for BI dashboards, enabling stakeholders to track key metrics daily.
Improved data quality and reliability by implementing monitoring systems and optimization techniques.
Enhanced data pipelines, reducing processing time and costs while delivering timely reports.
Developed predictive models that supported revenue growth and aligned with business KPIs for strategy and decision-making.

work.name: Dane Creek Capital Corp.
work.summary: Specialized in leveraging data visualization, pipeline architecture, and predictive modeling to drive insights for B2C, B2B, and logistics-focused operations.
highlights: Designed and deployed an open-source dashboard using Metabase, modernizing data visualization and reducing software licensing costs by 40%.
Architected a centralized data pipeline on Airflow, hosted by GCP, integrating CRM, ERP, and analytics sources, reducing report generation time and improving data accuracy.
Developed predictive models using machine learning, Python, SQL, and BigQuery, increasing customer retention with churn prediction and product recommendation systems.
Created interactive dashboards using Tableau, Looker Studio, and Metabase, enhancing data literacy and enabling faster responses to market trends.
Designed database systems and user-friendly applications, reducing manual data entry and decreasing data-related errors by automating validation and quality checks.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to translate business questions into analytical tasks, optimizing production and inventory management to reduce costs.
Utilized GCP and Azure for large-scale data management, implementing cloud security best practices and improving budget accuracy with financial analysis models.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: University of Calgary & Southwest Petroleum University (Cohort)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

certificates.name: Python for Data Analysis and Visualization
Object Oriented Programming in Java
certificates.issuer: Coursera | Duck University, UC San Diego

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Raven’s Progressive Matrices (RPM) Agent
projects.summary: Designed an AI agent to solve Raven’s Progressive Matrices, a human intelligence test, using knowledge-based AI techniques. Achieved 80% accuracy on advanced visual analogy problems.
highlights: Implemented an AI agent to process visual analogy problems in 2x2 and 3x3 formats
Reflected on human cognition by modeling AI to achieve human-like reasoning

projects.name: American Sign Language Recognition with Hidden Markov Models
projects.summary: Designed and implemented an AI agent leveraging Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) to recognize American Sign Language (ASL) gestures from video input.
highlights: Trained HMMs on a dataset of ASL signs, achieving accurate recognition of gestures with high confidence levels

projects.name: Job Application Timeline Tracker (Android App)
projects.summary: Developed a full-featured Android app to track job application timelines, enabling users to organize, edit, and monitor applications from start to finish.
highlights: Designed a user-friendly interface for managing job applications
Utilized IntelliJ IDEA for development and Android SQLite for data storage
Followed a comprehensive software development process, including design, test planning, and documentation
